intro: Oldenlandia drymarioides, commonly known as the coralroot or false toadflax, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands. It has slender, creeping stems and is known for its ability to form dense mats. Its flowers are pollinated by insects, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds.
